page.title: 05THE ARISTOCRATIC INFLUENCE
page.content: The {Earls of Coventry}have played a big part in the history and development of the area. It was the Sixth Earl who was resposible for some of the more distinguished buildings in Severn Stoke. The Panorama on top of Knights Hill was built as a signal tower. The watchman kept a look-out here for the Earl's coaches and signalled his arrival to Croome Court, so the gates could be opened without delay. He also built a harness house for hanging the horse leathers, which still stands by the A38, south of the village. In 1840, he built a large house at Severn Bank for his French Mistress, which is now used as a retirement home.
